title: Spurs captain Son Heung-min set to seal Los Angeles FC move in MLS record deal
description: The 33-year-old bid an emotional farewell to Tottenham in his home country of South Korea at the weekend.
content:

Tottenham captain Son Heung-min is expected to complete his transfer to Los Angeles FC on Wednesday.

Son revealed on Saturday, before playing in Sunday’s pre-season 1-1 draw with Newcastle in his home country of South Korea, that he would leave Spurs after a decade of service for the Premier League club.

After an emotional farewell, Son arrived in Los Angeles on Tuesday and watched LAFC clinch a 2-1 win over Tigres at BMO Stadium.

A press conference has since been arranged by the Major League Soccer club for 1400 local time (2200BST) on Wednesday, when Son’s arrival is set to be officially announced.

The 33-year-old made the decision to bring his time at Tottenham to an end this summer after he helped the club end a 17-year trophy drought in May with Europa League final success over Manchester United.

With Son into the final 12 months of his deal at Spurs, the South Korea forward felt it was the right time for a “fresh challenge”, having signed from Bayer Leverkusen in 2015.

LAFC had already indicated their interest in Son by this point and a deal for a fee in excess of £20million has been reached with Tottenham, the PA news agency understands.

Son’s transfer will be an MLS record, surpassing the 21.5m US dollars Atlanta spent on signing forward Emmanuel Latte Lath from Middlesbrough in February.

Spurs stalwart Son will exit north London after scoring 173 goals in 454 appearances.
summary: Tottenham captain Son Heung-min is set to complete his transfer to Los Angeles FC in a record-breaking MLS record deal. The 33-year-old South Korean forward will leave Tottenham after a decade of service at the club. His transfer will be an MLS record, surpassing the 21.5m US dollars Atlanta spent on signing forward Emmanuel Latte Lath from Middlesbrough in February. Son, who had previously scored 173 goals in 454 appearances for Tottenham, made the decision to leave this summer after helping the club end their 17-year trophy drought with Europa League final win over Manchester United. A press conference has been arranged for the Major League Soccer club for 1400 local time (2200BST) on Wednesday.
shortSummary: Tottenham's Son Heung-min is set to move to Los Angeles FC for a MLS record fee, surpassing Atlanta's spending of nearly £20m.
argos_summary: Tottenham captain Son Heung-min is set to complete his transfer to Los Angeles FC, following a decade at Spurs where he scored 173 goals in 454 appearances. After helping Tottenham end a 17-year trophy drought with a Europa League victory, Son expressed a desire for a 'fresh challenge' as he enters the final year of his contract. The transfer fee is reported to exceed £20 million, making it a record for Major League Soccer.
